snippet: A lower court says it does not have the jurisdiction to decide whether to disqualify Uhuru Kenyatta and his running mate because of charges brought by the International Criminal Court.
abstract: Kenyan court declines to intervene in hotly contested presidential race, saying it does not have authority to decide whether candidate Uhuru Kenyatta and his running mate William Ruto should be disqualified; they have been charged with crimes against humanity by International Criminal Court, in connection with the violence that erupted after Kenya’s last election, in 2007, when more than 1,000 people died.
lead_paragraph: A lower court says it does not have the jurisdiction to decide whether to disqualify Uhuru Kenyatta and his running mate because of charges brought by the International Criminal Court.

headline.seo: Kenyan Court Rejects Suit Against Kenyatta’s Candidacy
headline.main: Kenyan Court Rejects Suit Against Presidential Candidate
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Court Rejects Suit Against Presidential Candidate

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
